Package cp213

Class Term

java.lang.Object
cp213.Term
public class Term extends Object
Represents an individual term of a polynomial, containing the coefficient (double) and exponent (integer) of a term. Implements term addition, subtraction, multiplication, negation, and differential. TODO: division The contents of a Term may not be not be changed once constructed, thus there are no setters and methods that manipulate a Term must return a new Term. Some Term methods may throw an exception where two terms are used and their exponents do not match as required.
Version:
2022-03-18
Author:
your name, David Brown

  • Constructor Details

    • Term

      public Term(double coefficient, int exponent) throws Exception
      Constructs a new Term given a coefficient and exponent.
      Parameters:
      coefficient - The Term coefficient.
      exponent - The Term exponent.
      Throws:
      Exception - If exponent is negative, throws Exception with message: "negative exponents not allowed"

    • Term

      public Term(Term that)
      Copy constructor. The contents of that are unchanged.
      Parameters:
      that - The Term object to copy.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public Term add(Term that) throws Exception
      Adds two Term objects together and returns the resulting new Term. The two Term objects must have the same exponent value. The contents of this and that are unchanged.
      Parameters:
      that - The Term object to add to this Term object.
      Returns:
      The Term that results from adding this and that.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the exponents of this and that are not identical, throws Exception with message: "exponents do not match"

    • differential

      public Term differential() throws Exception
      Returns a new Term object that is the differential of this Term. If this exponent is 0, sets the both the coefficient and exponent of the new Term to 0. The contents of this are unchanged.
      Returns:
      The differential of this, or Term(0, 0) if the differentiation reduces this exponent to less than zero.
      Throws:
      Exception - from Term constructor

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Term that)
      Returns whether this Term object and another Term object are the same object, or contain equivalent attributes.
      Parameters:
      that - The Term object to compare this Term object to.
      Returns:
      true if this and that are the same object or contain equivalent attributes, false otherwise.

    • getCoefficient

      public double getCoefficient()
      Returns:
      this coefficient.

    • getExponent

      public int getExponent()
      Returns:
      this exponent.

    • multiply

      public Term multiply(Term that) throws Exception
      Multiplies this Term with another Term and returns the result in a new Term. The contents of this and that are unchanged.
      Parameters:
      that - The other Term to multiply this Term with.
      Returns:
      The result of multiplying this Term with that Term.
      Throws:
      Exception - from Term constructor

    • negate

      public Term negate() throws Exception
      Negates this Term, i.e. the coefficient is multiplied by -1. The contents of this are unchanged.
      Returns:
      a negated version of the current Term.
      Throws:
      Exception - from Term constructor

    • subtract

      public Term subtract(Term that) throws Exception
      Subtracts another Term from this Term. The two Term objects must have the same exponent value. The contents of this and that are unchanged.
      Parameters:
      that - The Term to subtract from this Term.
      Returns:
      The new Term resulting from subtracting that Term from this Term.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the exponents of this and that are not identical, throws Exception with message: "exponents do not match"

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string of format: ax^n where a is the coefficient, and n is the exponent. Returns "x^n" if a == 1, "ax" if n == 1, "a" if n == 0, "0" if a == 0.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
